option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"D:/IdeaProjects/login-demo":"{\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/controller/response/CommonResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class `CommonResponse` and several static methods within it.\\n\\n`CommonResponse`: A generic class that represents a common response structure with a status code, message, and data.\\n\\n`CommonResponse()`: The default constructor for the `CommonResponse` class.\\n\\n`CommonResponse(int, String, T)`: A constructor for the `CommonResponse` class that takes a status code, message, and data.\\n\\n`success(T)`: A static method that creates a successful `CommonResponse` with a status code of 200 and the provided data.\\n\\n`success(String, T)`: A static method that creates a successful `CommonResponse` with a status code of 200, a custom message, and the provided data.\\n\\n`failure(int, String)`: A static method that creates a failed `CommonResponse` with the provided status code and message.\\n\\n`getCode()`, `setCode(int)`, `getMessage()`, `setMessage(String)`, `getData()`, `setData(T)`: Getter and setter methods for the properties of the `CommonResponse` class.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/controller/HomeController.java\":\"This file is a Spring Boot controller class that handles user authentication and login functionality.\\n\\n`HomeController`: This class is responsible for handling user authentication and login requests.\\n\\n`login`: This function processes the login request, verifies the user\\u0027s credentials, generates a JWT token, and sets the token in the response header.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/domain/repo/impl/MyBatisAccountRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single class and one function:\\n\\n`MyBatisAccountRepository`: This class is a repository implementation that uses MyBatis to interact with the database and retrieve account information.\\n\\n`findByUsername`: This function retrieves an `Account` entity from the database based on the provided username.\\n\\nThe file is responsible for implementing the `AccountRepo` interface, which is part of the domain layer of the application. It uses the `AccountMapper` and `AccountConverter` classes from the infrastructure layer to interact with the database and convert the retrieved data into the appropriate domain model.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/config/WebConfig.java\":\"This file is a Spring Boot configuration class that sets up a web interceptor to handle JWT (JSON Web Token) authentication for all incoming requests.\\n\\n`WebConfig`: This class implements the `WebMvcConfigurer` interface and configures the web application to use the `JwtInterceptor`.\\n\\n`addInterceptors`: This function adds the `JwtInterceptor` to the `InterceptorRegistry`, which will intercept all incoming requests (`/**`) and handle the JWT authentication.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/annotation/PassToken.java\":\"This file defines a custom annotation called `PassToken` that can be used on methods or classes to indicate that a token is not required for authentication.\\n\\n`PassToken`: An annotation that can be used to mark methods or classes as not requiring authentication.\\n\\n`required()`: A method within the `PassToken` annotation that allows the developer to specify whether a token is required or not, with a default value of `true`.\",\"/login-demo/src/test/java/com/example/logindemo/util/JwtUtilTest.java\":\"This file contains a test suite for the `JwtUtil` class, which is responsible for generating and parsing JSON Web Tokens (JWT) for authentication and authorization purposes.\\n\\n`JwtUtilTest`: This class tests the functionality of the `JwtUtil` class.\\n\\n`testGenerateAndParseToken()`: This test verifies that the `JwtUtil` can generate a valid JWT token and correctly parse the username from the token.\\n\\n`testTokenNotExpired()`: This test checks that the generated JWT token is not expired.\\n\\n`testSecretLoadedFromConfig()`: This test ensures that the JWT secret is correctly loaded from the application configuration.\\n\\n`testTokenExpirationLogic()`: This test is a placeholder for testing the token expiration logic, which is not implemented in the provided code.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/infra/po/AccountPO.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `AccountPO`, which represents an account in the system.\\n\\n`AccountPO`: A class that represents an account with an ID, username, password, and email.\\n\\n`getId()`: Returns the ID of the account.\\n`setId(Long id)`: Sets the ID of the account.\\n`getUsername()`: Returns the username of the account.\\n`setUsername(String username)`: Sets the username of the account.\\n`getPassword()`: Returns the password of the account.\\n`setPassword(String password)`: Sets the password of the account.\\n`getEmail()`: Returns the email of the account.\\n`setEmail(String email)`: Sets the email of the account.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/util/JsonUtil.java\":\"This file contains a utility class `JsonUtil` that provides methods for working with JSON data.\\n\\n`JsonUtil`: A utility class that provides methods for converting objects to and from JSON strings, as well as validating JSON data.\\n\\n`toJson(Object obj)`: Converts the given object to a JSON string.\\n\\n`toObj(String json, Class\\u003cT\\u003e clazz)`: Converts the given JSON string to an object of the specified class.\\n\\n`toObj(String json, TypeReference\\u003cT\\u003e typeRef)`: Converts the given JSON string to an object of the specified type reference (e.g., a complex container like a List or Map).\\n\\n`isValidJson(String json)`: Checks if the given string is a valid JSON.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/controller/response/UserInfoResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `UserInfoResponse`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent user information in a response.\\n\\n`UserInfoResponse`: A DTO class that holds user information, including the user\\u0027s ID, username, and email.\\n\\n`getId()`: Returns the user\\u0027s ID.\\n`setId(Long id)`: Sets the user\\u0027s ID.\\n`getUsername()`: Returns the user\\u0027s username.\\n`setUsername(String username)`: Sets the user\\u0027s username.\\n`getEmail()`: Returns the user\\u0027s email.\\n`setEmail(String email)`: Sets the user\\u0027s email.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/config/JwtInterceptor.java\":\"This file contains a single class and several functions. Here\\u0027s the summary:\\n\\n`JwtInterceptor`: A Spring MVC interceptor that handles JWT token validation for incoming requests.\\n\\n`preHandle`: Intercepts incoming requests, checks for a valid JWT token, and allows or denies access to the requested resource based on the token\\u0027s validity.\\n\\nThis file implements a JWT token-based authentication and authorization mechanism for a Spring MVC application. It checks the presence and validity of the JWT token in incoming requests, and either allows or denies access to the requested resource based on the token\\u0027s validity.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/domain/model/Role.java\":\"This file defines a `Role` class, which represents a role in a user authentication system.\\n\\n`Role`: A class that represents a user role, with an ID, name, and a list of permissions associated with the role.\\n\\n`getId()`: Returns the ID of the role.\\n`setId(Long id)`: Sets the ID of the role.\\n`getName()`: Returns the name of the role.\\n`setName(String name)`: Sets the name of the role.\\n`getPermissions()`: Returns the list of permissions associated with the role.\\n`setPermissions(List\\u003cPermission\\u003e permissions)`: Sets the list of permissions associated with the role.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/config/JwtProperties.java\":\"This file contains a single class and no functions.\\n\\n`JwtProperties`: This class is used to store the JWT (JSON Web Token) configuration properties, such as the secret key and the expiration time, which can be loaded from the application\\u0027s configuration.\\n\\nThe file as a whole provides a way to externalize the JWT configuration settings, making it easier to manage and update them without modifying the application code directly.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/LoginDemoApplication.java\":\"This file is the main class for a Spring Boot application called `LoginDemoApplication`. It does not contain any additional classes or functions, but rather serves as the entry point for the application.\\n\\n`LoginDemoApplication`: This is the main class that bootstraps the Spring Boot application and starts the application context.\\n\\n`main(String[] args)`: This is the main method that is executed when the application is run. It calls the `run()` method of the `SpringApplication` class to start the application.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/domain/model/Permission.java\":\"This file defines a `Permission` record class, which represents a permission with an ID, name, and description.\\n\\n`Permission`: A record class that represents a permission with an ID, name, and description.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/domain/repo/AccountRepo.java\":\"This file defines an interface called `AccountRepo` that provides a method for finding an `Account` object by its username.\\n\\n`AccountRepo`: An interface that defines a repository for managing `Account` objects.\\n\\n`findByUsername(String username)`: A method that retrieves an `Account` object by its username.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/config/GlobalExceptionHandler.java\":\"This file is a Spring Boot configuration class that handles global exceptions in a web application.\\n\\n`GlobalExceptionHandler`: This class is a `@RestControllerAdvice` that provides a centralized exception handling mechanism for the application.\\n\\n`handleException`: This function handles all unhandled exceptions and returns a `CommonResponse` with a 500 status code and the exception message.\\n\\n`handleRuntimeException`: This function handles all `RuntimeException` exceptions and returns a `CommonResponse` with a 500 status code and the exception message.\\n\\n`handleUnauthorizedException`: This function handles `ResponseStatusException` exceptions with a 401 Unauthorized status code and returns a `CommonResponse` with a 401 status code and the exception reason.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/util/JwtUtil.java\":\"This file contains a utility class `JwtUtil` that provides functionality for generating, parsing, and validating JSON Web Tokens (JWT).\\n\\n`JwtUtil`: A utility class that provides methods for generating, parsing, and validating JWT tokens.\\n\\n`generateToken(String username)`: Generates a JWT token with the provided username as the subject and the configured expiration time.\\n\\n`parseUsername(String token)`: Parses a JWT token and returns the username (subject) contained within it.\\n\\n`isTokenExpired(String token)`: Checks if a given JWT token has expired based on the expiration time stored in the token.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/service/AccountService.java\":\"This file defines an interface called `AccountService` that provides a single method `login` for user authentication.\\n\\n`AccountService`: An interface that defines the contract for user authentication operations.\\n\\n`login`: A method that takes a username and password as input and returns a `UserLoginResult` object representing the result of the login attempt.\",\"/login-demo/src/test/java/com/example/logindemo/LoginDemoApplicationTests.java\":\"This file is a test class for the `LoginDemoApplication` class in a Spring Boot application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test method `contextLoads()` that is used to ensure the application context loads successfully.\\n\\n`LoginDemoApplicationTests`: This is a test class that verifies the Spring Boot application context loads correctly.\\n\\n`contextLoads()`: This test method ensures the Spring Boot application context can be loaded without any issues.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/infra/converter/AccountConverter.java\":\"This file contains a utility class `AccountConverter` that provides methods to convert between the `Account` domain model and the `AccountPO` persistence object.\\n\\n`AccountConverter`: A utility class that provides methods to convert between the `Account` domain model and the `AccountPO` persistence object.\\n\\n`toEntity(AccountPO)`: Converts an `AccountPO` object to an `Account` object.\\n`toPO(Account)`: Converts an `Account` object to an `AccountPO` object.\",\"/login-demo/src/test/java/com/example/logindemo/controller/LoginIntegrationTest.java\":\"This file contains an integration test for a login functionality in a Spring Boot application.\\n\\n`LoginIntegrationTest`: This class tests the login functionality and the access to a protected endpoint.\\n\\n`webClient()`: This function creates a `WebTestClient` instance to make HTTP requests to the application.\\n\\n`testLoginAndAccessProtectedEndpoint()`: This function tests the login process, extracts the token, and then uses the token to access a protected endpoint. It also tests the case where no token is provided.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/service/dto/UserLoginResult.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `UserLoginResult`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent the result of a user login operation.\\n\\n`UserLoginResult`: A DTO class that holds the user\\u0027s ID, username, and email after a successful login.\\n\\n`UserLoginResult()`: The default constructor for the `UserLoginResult` class.\\n\\n`UserLoginResult(Long id, String username, String email)`: The parameterized constructor for the `UserLoginResult` class, which initializes the user\\u0027s ID, username, and email.\\n\\n`getId()`: Returns the user\\u0027s ID.\\n\\n`setId(Long id)`: Sets the user\\u0027s ID.\\n\\n`getUsername()`: Returns the user\\u0027s username.\\n\\n`setUsername(String username)`: Sets the user\\u0027s username.\\n\\n`getEmail()`: Returns the user\\u0027s email.\\n\\n`setEmail(String email)`: Sets the user\\u0027s email.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/domain/model/Account.java\":\"This file defines a single class, `Account`, which represents a user account with an ID, username, password, and email.\\n\\n`Account`: A class that represents a user account with an ID, username, password, and email.\\n\\n`Account(String, String, String)`: A constructor that creates an `Account` object with a username, password, and email.\\n\\n`Account(Long, String, String, String)`: A constructor that creates an `Account` object with an ID, username, password, and email.\\n\\n`Account(String, String)`: A constructor that creates an `Account` object with a username and password.\\n\\n`Account(Long, String, String)`: A constructor that creates an `Account` object with an ID, username, and password.\\n\\n`getEmail()`: Returns the email of the `Account` object.\\n\\n`setEmail(String)`: Sets the email of the `Account` object.\\n\\n`matchPassword(String)`: Checks if the input password matches the password of the `Account` object.\\n\\n`getUsername()`: Returns the username of the `Account` object.\\n\\n`getPassword()`: Returns the password of the `Account` object.\\n\\n`getId()`: Returns the ID of the `Account` object.\\n\\n`setId(Long)`: Sets the ID of the `Account` object.\\n\\n`setUsername(String)`: Sets the username of the `Account` object.\\n\\n`setPassword(String)`: Sets the password of the `Account` object.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/infra/mapper/AccountMapper.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes, but it does contain the following function:\\n\\n`findByUsername`: This function retrieves an `AccountPO` object from the database based on the provided `username`.\\n\\nThe file is an interface for a MyBatis mapper, which is used to interact with a database. The interface defines a single method, `findByUsername`, that retrieves an `AccountPO` object from the database based on the provided `username`.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/controller/request/LoginRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `LoginRequest`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent the login credentials submitted by a user.\\n\\n`LoginRequest`: A class that represents the login credentials (username and password) submitted by a user.\\n\\n`LoginRequest()`: The default constructor for the `LoginRequest` class.\\n\\n`LoginRequest(String username, String password)`: A constructor that initializes the `username` and `password` fields of the `LoginRequest` class.\\n\\n`getUsername()`: A getter method that returns the `username` field of the `LoginRequest` class.\\n\\n`setUsername(String username)`: A setter method that sets the `username` field of the `LoginRequest` class.\\n\\n`getPassword()`: A getter method that returns the `password` field of the `LoginRequest` class.\\n\\n`setPassword(String password)`: A setter method that sets the `password` field of the `LoginRequest` class.\",\"/login-demo/src/main/java/com/example/logindemo/service/impl/AccountServiceImpl.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `AccountService` interface, which is responsible for handling user login functionality.\\n\\n`AccountServiceImpl`: This class implements the `AccountService` interface and provides the implementation for the `login` method.\\n\\n`login`: This function takes a username and password as input, and returns a `UserLoginResult` object containing the user\\u0027s ID, username, and email if the login is successful, or `null` if the login fails.\"}"}
